course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Solid State Chemistry
course.description: Structure and bonding in solids; metals, semiconductors and dielectrics; crystal chemistry of ceramics, silicate minerals and zeolites; electrical, optical and magnetic properties of solids; fullerene chemistry; introduction to x-ray diffraction, electron microscopy, etc.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Just like another review, Prof. Yan really emphasize presentation skills, and what he thinks are important(Usually they will be tested)

He hates overtime presentation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Presentation: 50%
Final: 50%

Prof. Yan divided the 50% presentation into 3 presentation
1:1min (Free topic) ~8%
2:10mins (Assigned topic) ~18%
3:10mins (Free topic) ~24%

As Prof. Yan didn't give us how many mark...I can't really say(Although you can ask, I didn't...)
I think grade is great...As I just prepared eachpresentation for 2 days, and watch 2 months of video in 1 week, and I got A-
reviews.comment_workload:
As mentioned, I just prepared presentation for 2 days each, and watch 2 months of video in 1 week

It is because Prof. Yan will emphasize what he wants you to know or what contents he think are important, and they will be tested.

reviews.author: cheeeeeeeeee
reviews.comment_content:
Some basics on solid state chemistry

- Basics on solid state chemistry
-Bonding, structures, properties
-Different applications
-Properties
-Organic Solar cells
-Semiconductors
-Crystallography (in which most of the midterm came from)
-Silicate
-Defects & Energetics of solids
-Phase Diagram (Final is mostly based on this part)
-Materials Preparation
-Materials Characterization

But I felt that the contents were not really in depth, might have been better if we could delve bit further to the topic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He puts lots of emphasis on presentation skills.

But often felt that he often talks about other science/ his own experiences regarding the topic. But I think his explanations with course materials were lucid and clear for me to understand.

I think it is important to actually attend the lectures as he points out what he this is very important, and what he will test on your exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Presentation: 50%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 25%

I thought the overall grading was pretty good.
reviews.comment_workload:
Simple.
Not much workload for this course
He also cancelled 4 lectures in this semester after long presentation day. (Because he wanted everyone to do their practice presentation + actual presentation on the same day.)
